title: Nuclear reactions - energy released in decay

content.question: An unstable nucleus of mass <math alttext="M sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> decays. The resulting products due to the decay have total mass <math alttext="M sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. Which expression is equal to the energy released during the decay that is equivalent to the difference in mass between the original nucleus and the products?

choices.label: <math alttext="M sub 0, end sub, times c squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="M sub f, end sub, times c squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, M sub 0, end sub, plus M sub f, close parenthesis, times c squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, M sub 0, end sub, minus M sub f, close parenthesis, times c squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, M sub 0, end sub, minus M sub f, close parenthesis, times c squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
